paper_abstract: The Varieties of Enactivism: A Conceptual Geography 4th April 2014, was a one day symposium which took place at Goldsmith University, London. The symposium had the explicit aim of clarifying the status of enactive cognitive science both as a unified paradigm for cognitive science and in relation to the broader embodied cognition framework. In what follows I offer a brief summery of the various talks followed by some thoughts on the current state of play within enactivism.
paper_title: Can the revolution be optimised? Oh yes it can! But, maybe not. Report on the one day symposium on "Varieties of Enactivism"
